item.title: Basic Curl usage
item.description: Curl is a http client that can be used from the command line. It has tons of options and here I will list some of some that I find most useful. For a detailed usage guide, go to https://everything.curl.dev/ (maintained by the Curl author). Output options Show verbose output (e.g TLS handshake etc.) curl -v <url> Hide progress bar output curl -s <url> Show response headers curl -i <url> Options that don’t take arguments can be combined like this:
